Reviews.original: The artwork includes noticeable deformations that add to its artistic expression. The exaggerated size of the red bow and the vibrant, oversized rainbow contribute to a whimsical and joyful atmosphere. The raised arms and smiling faces of the children are slightly exaggerated, enhancing the sense of excitement and unity. However, these deformations, while charming, are somewhat disjointed from the overall composition, offering a mixed impact on the viewer. The artwork effectively uses deformation to express a cheerful and inclusive message, but the integration of these elements could be more seamless.

The artwork effectively uses deformation to express a cheerful and inclusive message, but the integration of these elements could be more seamless.Egyptian frontal painting. This painting method is often used in ancient Egyptian murals or relief works, reflecting the ancient Egyptians' observation and expression of human body proportions. In this type of work, the frontal painting of the upper body of the character highlights the ornamental value, such as the eyes, body decorations and other details, while the side painting method below the waist can clearly express the hips and legs. This method of distorting the size relationship is believed to enhance the expressiveness and visibility of the picture.
Reviews.added: Egyptian frontal painting. This painting method is often used in ancient Egyptian murals or relief works, reflecting the ancient Egyptians' observation and expression of human body proportions. In this type of work, the frontal painting of the upper body of the character highlights the ornamental value, such as the eyes, body decorations and other details, while the side painting method below the waist can clearly express the hips and legs. This method of distorting the size relationship is believed to enhance the expressiveness and visibility of the picture.
